org.openimaj.ml.clustering.assignment

Interface SoftAssigner<DATATYPE,DISTANCES>

  • Type Parameters:
    DATATYPE - the primitive array datatype which represents a centroid of this cluster.
    DISTANCES - primitive array datatype for recording distances between points and cluster centroids.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Assigner<DATATYPE>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteKNNAssigner, DoubleKNNAssigner, FloatKNNAssigner, HierarchicalBytePathAssigner, HierarchicalDoublePathAssigner, HierarchicalFloatPathAssigner, HierarchicalIntPathAssigner, HierarchicalLongPathAssigner, HierarchicalShortPathAssigner, IntKNNAssigner, LongKNNAssigner, ShortKNNAssigner

    public interface SoftAssigner<DATATYPE,DISTANCES>
extends Assigner<DATATYPE>
    The SoftAssigner interface describes classes that assign a spatial point to multiple clusters, possibly with weighting.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Detail

      • assign

        int[][] assign(DATATYPE[] data)
        Assign data to clusters.
        Parameters:
        data - the data.
        Returns:
        The cluster indices which the data was assigned to.

      • assign

        int[] assign(DATATYPE data)
        Assign a single point to some clusters.
        Parameters:
        data - datum to assign.
        Returns:
        the assigned cluster indices.

      • assignWeighted

        void assignWeighted(DATATYPE[] data,
                  int[][] assignments,
                  DISTANCES[] weights)
        Assign data to clusters. The results are returned in the indices and distances arrays. The return arrays must have the same length as the data array.
        Parameters:
        data - the data.
        assignments - the cluster indices for each data point.
        weights - the weights to the for each cluster for each data point.

      • assignWeighted

        IndependentPair<int[],DISTANCES> assignWeighted(DATATYPE data)
        Assign a single point to some clusters.
        Parameters:
        data - point to assign.
        Returns:
        the assigned cluster indices and weights.
